headline: Lemon Pie Bars
description: Tangy lemon filling on a buttery short bread crust. This is a really easy recipe that my mom made before the lemon bar 'rage' was on!

video.description: A deliciously classic lemon pie bar dessert!
video.name: Lemon Pie Bars

name: Lemon Pie Bars

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix 2 cups of flour and confectioner's sugar together. Cut in the butter or margarine. Mix well until the dough resembles pie dough consistency. Press the dough into a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Beat together eggs, sugar, 4 tablespoons flour, lemon juice and lemon rind for at least 1 minute. Pour the mixture over the baked crust.
Bake the bars another 20 minutes, or until the lemon topping has set. Sprinkle with confectioner's sugar when cooled.

review.reviewBody: I halfed the recipe and it came out perfect! Easy to make and it's a keeper for me.
Here’s the trick - use the base from the The Best Lemon Bar recipe with this filling. Perfection
I would double the filling but otherwise the bars are great. Seriously use real butter. Margarine creates a soggy crust and the filling is weepy like a bad meringue.
yummy only change i made was double the filling and it was perfect!!

The tartness of these bars was right on for us. I made a half recipe in an 8x8 pan, but otherwise made as directed. My only complaint is that they are incredibly thin. I am worried that simply doubling the filling will result in an overly tart flavor for us. I will have to experiment a little, but think it is worth it. I also recommend tapping the pan on the counter a few times, before placing it in the oven, to remove any air bubbles.

It’s almost identical to the one with the same name I probably got about the same time as your mom did ages ago. The only differences is my crust only has 2 c flour and the filling calls 4 T flour. It’s always been a favorite. Thanks for sharing.

The recipe was delicious however I don’t normally bake so when it said to press the dough in the pan I did just that and after cooking I couldn’t find my filling. Eventually I figured out the mixture ran underneath the crust and so my filling was under the crust. It was upside down lemon bars. I feel like the instructions should have specified to make sure the crust goes up the sides a little so the filling will sit inside. It is a recipe after all so the instructions should be clear.

no bad for starter recipes i used it as a building stone i used store bought pie crust and pre baked that first in a 7x11 glass baking pan with foil under it and kept the filling the same but i used three lemons and 1 1/2 lemon zest and a small pinch of salt and it was amazing everyone even my little ones who are 2 loved it will make agian

I made this recipe according to the directions in spite of many comments that the crust was too thick in proportion to the filling. The recipe calls for 2 1/4 C flour total but later states to add 4 Tbsp flour to the filling. So I used 2 C flour for the crust and the remaining crust ingredients. I also added a pinch of salt but that was not enough. My only constructive comment (and reason for 4 stars instead of 5) is the crust does not have a lot of flavor. I would suggest 1/8-1/4 tsp salt or use salted butter. I also added a pinch of salt to the filling. Other than that, I thought these were terrific. The amount of filling to crust ratio I thought was just fine. Maybe some folks are looking for filling depth closer to pie filling. But for bars, I thought these were perfect and the recipe couldn’t be simpler to follow. They go together quick. While the crust is baking, make the filling. I added the filling to a hot crust and put back in the oven. They are delish.
Made this treat before dinner and 3/4 of it was gone within 14-20 minutes.
YUM! We loved these! I had 3 lemons that I needed to use, so I had a little more than 1/2 cup juice, more like 2/3. I didn't change anything else in the recipe. They were perfect!

This recipe was okay. Crust was thick and kind of overpowered the lemony flavor. It was also pretty crumbly, instead of flaky. I added almost 2/3 cup lemon juice as suggested in comments, but I still felt like I got more butter crust than the lemon I was looking for
Delicious!! Super easy and loaded with flavor!

I want to start out by saying this is literally the 3rd thing I have ever attempted to bake in my life haha my grandmother recently passed and now I just want to bake because it’s something she always did... 

I made this recipe this evening and 
I *tried to* follow it exactly as written. 

My thoughts are: 

I was concerned about the crust right off the gate because it was so flaky but it seemed to pat down okay however the size of the pan requested was too big so I had to go down a bit in size but wasn’t sure how thick the crust was supposed to be either. It didn’t make the golden brown look so much after 25 mins of baking at 350 so I took it out to feel it and it felt like it was done so I just went on with the recipe. 

Again the size of the pan was an issue, even after going down in size a little, the wet mix barely covered the crust. 

I baked it at 350 for 20 mins and when I took it out it looked like my pic above. 

And just to touch on the size of the pan again. 
Did others have an issue with that too or are these supposed to be rather thin? 

That being said, it actually tastes really dang good so at least the flavours
add more lemon
Extra lemon. No such thing as too much lemon. Added loads of juice and zest. Worth it.
Makes for a delicious tea time snack or a nice dessert. I cut the sugar to one cup.
Super easy and really delicious. Made exactly as recipe instructed.
Amazing

Best lemon bar recipe I’ve found. Nice buttery crust filled with the perfect balance of sweet/tart lemony goodness! Other than increasing the filling by a half, I make excactly as written. Always a requested favorite in this house.

Forgiving recipe! I accidentally added the entire 2-1/4c flour to my crust and didn't have a lemon on hand to zest, but these came out beautifully anyway. I grated frozen butter into the flour/sugar and pressed it in lightly for a flaky crust. 18min in the oven for the crust and 25min for the second bake produced a heavenly custard on just the right amount of crust. Thank you!
The crust amount is just fine, and the sugar looks great on top!

Excellent recipe! Just perfect balance between crust and lemon. I halved the recipe and cooked in an 8x8 glass pan. The only change I made was adding about 1/2 T of lemon rind into the crust. Such an easy and delicious dessert! Thank you!

First time making this and it did not disappoint. My husband thinks they are amazing. I used an 8x11 glass dish, and very lightly greased it using the butter wrappers. I increased the lemon juice to about a cup, with about 2 TBS of zest. I cooked the crust for 20 minutes and though it wasn’t golden on top, I could see the underside was done. The top cooked for 20 minutes and it came out perfect. I cooled it for about an hour on the counter, in the pan, then sifted some powdered sugar. It was delicious warm.
SO GOOD we all loved them, they just needed to be baked with the lemon for a bit longer
Good I wrote it down in my book of recipes so the rest of my family can try it!!

It turned out delicious! However warning the pie crust at the bottom of the dish is very crumbly and that and the lemon mixture seperate as you eat it. However if you just eat it with a spoon it’s delicious.
I don’t know if I messed it up or if it’s just bad but this definitely didn’t have the look or texture advertised
Turned out great! Thought the ratio of shortbread was perfect.
I love this recipe!!!!! it is really good!!!! the texture of the crust and the filling goes together really good!!

I followed this recipe and it’s soooooi good!!! I liked the ratio of the filling and crust. I love crust a lot so I didn’t mind the ratio. I put more than a sprinkle of powered sugar in the video just so it doesn’t disappear. My boys who are apprehensive about lemon bars really liked this one. I really recommend it. There were no changes to this recipe and I’ll leave it like that. Yummy and thumbs up!
easy to make. I combined the juice and zest of one lemon and one lime to make the filling. will definitely make this again.

Did exactly what everyone said & doubled the filling & used 2 cups of flour for the crust instead of 2 1/4 cups. I added a glaze on top when finished & then sprinkled powdered sugar afterwards!! Yummy!!
I loved it! It is perfect as is. I personally had to cook it 10 mins more but that's all.
I made this with a little added shredded coconut to the lemon custard and it added a nice tastey difference instead of just lemon.

I made these bars and followed the recipe to the letter. They taste very good, but the top had deep cracks...like an earthquake. And for a 9 x 13-inch pan, the lemon mixture isn't nearly enough. It's not as thick as the picture leads one to believe. I'm glad I wasn't making them for company.
These are without a doubt the best lemon bars I have ever made! I have a Meyer lemon tree here in AZ and I am sure that helps to make them good but I have tried other recipes and nothing compares.
I enjoyed this recipe as is. I might add more lemon juice to the drizzle next time. No matter what it as awesome.

This was the first time I have made lemon bars. I have to say that the custard was AMAZING! It was more than I expected. However, the thing that kept me from rating it a 5 star was the crust. Being the first time making it and only once before tasting it, it seemed the crust was doughy, not crispier like I thought it would be. However it looked like the picture so maybe I was expecting the wrong thing. I will continue to use the recipe and enjoy it.

Multiply this filling, and it would make a great pie! As the other reviews said; too much cookie crust. I would suggest rolling the crust with a pin to less than 1/4", then place in a quarter-sheet pan, making a good dough rim. Double the filling mix, and pour in til deep.

Good classic recipe for lemon bars, the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the crust to lemon curd ratio was off (too much crust). Next time I will adjust it, make a little less crust and it will be perfect.

Simple and perfect...living in California lemons growing in my yard. Delicious....Easy to make for Church and friends and family gathering...at the drop of a dime. All the ingredients are always at hand...most people in my circle have never had a lemon bar....we are used to peach cobblers and such!
.easy to make
Love it one of my fav recipes
Easy to make and great tasting.
delicious! I may add more lemon zest to make them tarter. I like lemon.
I read the reviews that it was "crust heavy", so I made 1 1/2 of the filling. Just for fun, I mixed half lemon juice / half orange juice. It's tangy & sweet!
Outstanding recipe!
Lemony but lacked a degree of satisfaction. The crust was dry and the filling wasn't as tart as I'd hoped despite adding a wee bit extra lemon zest.

Yummmm! Nice and tart. I halved the recipe, baked it in an 8x8, added 1 extra tsp. of zest, half of which I put into the crust. I baked the crust for 25 mins and the filling for 20.5 mins. Next time I would cook the crust for maybe 1 min less, although it is still amazing. Thanks!

This is a great recipe! These lemon bars are just the right amount of sweet and tangy. I’ve made these a few times and this time I made 1 1/2 times the filling as other people recommended and they did not come out as good. They taste fine but it’s too much filling. I’ll be sticking with the original recipe again. Thanks!

I was going to make this for a project for my class, but then when i made it, it turned out horrible! I had to put it in for 3 times the time it said. When it came out my father came in and said the top looked like slime. Thanks for such a horrible recipe.
Quick and delicious
My friends LOVED these, they were easy to do, next time will be lime. ??
I doubled the filling, and I will use this recipe again.
My husband loved this. Followed recipe as written.

I made these when I was at home bored one day and they went like hot cakes. I brought some to work and left some at home and everyone loved them. I would definitely say that you could safely reduce the amount of sugar in them because they are incredibly sweet. They turned out exactly as they should have without any complications or hiccups.
I used lemon flavoring as well so it wasn’t as tart and we love it!
I read one cup of butter as 1 stick and only put one stick of butter instead of 2 and they are still great!!!!!!! I have attention problems LOL!!
Love the bars! Less dough and more lemon for me, though. That's just my tastes.

The first time I made it, I followed the recipe as is and it came out great. The second time I made it, I used a mixture of ponderosa lemons, meyer lemons, and lime. The flavor was more complex. The third time I doubled the custard, added 1/4 tsp of salt and 1tbsp of lemon zest into the crust, also double the lemon custard, and it had a right balance of custard and crust for us. So...I’d say just experience with whatever limes/lemon you have and be surprised. We do like the combination of limes and lemons. It didn’t taste like a traditional lemon bar, but it was more fun.
These lemon bars were wonderful. They tasted more like mini lemon pies. Really good!
delish! i did find the crust was a bit too thick, so i doubled the filling the second time i made it. also, this recipe works with gluten free flour! (: definently will make these again!
It is a great recipe and I will definitely make it again!
I made this as directed, and it was delicious! My husband, who isn’t fond of lemon desserts, was crazy about it too!
Followed the recommendation of others to make one and a half times the filling and this was perfect!
Great recipe. People love it every time!
should note to not use glass baking dish. I will try again!
Was pleased with outcome being this was my first attempt at making a dessert, other than jello, from scratch.
Very tasty!

Very good! I have made this many times following the recipe perfectly and its as always wonderful. I do have to agree with one of the reviews that they are not pretty. But who cares if you just plan on vegging out in the recliner with a plate full?
Today I read all of the reviews and followed some advice, 1.5 times for the filling, they are very pretty and very yummy, so yes they are perfect any way that you make them... YUMMM! Thank you for sharing your recipe.
Now a staple recipe at our house. I followed the suggestion to use the zest from a whole lemon and my son-in-law said these were the best he'd ever had.
It turned out fine, not as thick as I expected
it was really easy to me so thats a plus
One of my favourite recipes! Always works really well and guests love it as a little treat! I add a little more butter to the crust to make it moister and easier to get out of the pan.

this is intense. I added extra lemon zest and doubled the topping amounts. great but maybe a bit too intense. cut smal pieces. to half I added a layer of seedless raspberry jam between the lemon and crust. I preferred the bars with the jam but they were still great either way. next time try 1.5 times lemon layer instead of double. the jam layer adds color and looks great. I skipped the icing sugar

These are DIVINE!! The crust is thick but so tasty. The lemon layer is tart but sweet. I might make 1.5 times the lemon next time, just because I love it so, but these turned out great following the recipe.
This recipe is perfect every time!!
it was the best recipe of lemon bars ever.
no changes, will cook again
Only modification I made were for dietary restrictions. My son's have gluten and dairy issues. I made with GF all-purpose flour and organic earth balance butter replacement- Fabulous!!

Just like other reviews (that I read after making) the pan size in the recipe is too large. I'd also suggest an 8x11 instead. I had to make 1/2 of the lemmon, eggs and sugar filling again just to be able to cover the crust.

I made no changes to this receipe and I found the crust to thick and the lemon mixture to thin. 
I would half the crust ingredients. The crust and filling were good but I think I should stick to my lemon pies they always turn out great.

I made this recipe for the first time and it is delicious! I will definitely be making this again. I followed the suggestion of other reviewers and increased the lemon filling 1 1/2. It was the perfect ratio of crust to filling. This is a must try!!
A bit of trouble to make as you are making pie dough from scratch, however....as the days go on...the Lemon bar gets better and better and better!!!! Everyone loves them.....

Made it exactly as written and it came out nicely but not as lemony as I expected. I will be making it again but will increase the lemon zest or perhaps add a small amount of lemon oil to pump up the pucker !
I did not make any changes in the recipe. However the crust was very dry and not at all flaky. I would make a different crust next time. The filling was delicious!

I followed this recipe to the letter, except for the final step. First, the crust didn’t brown in 15 mins. or in 20 mins or even in 30 mins, but that’s when I stopped baking it. At least the bottom of the crust was browned. The lemony topping was extremely thin using the recommended 9x13 pan, whereas the accompanying recipe pictures showed that layer to be nearly 1/2 inch thick. Where I did differ from the recipe is at the end. Instead of dusting the lemon bars with sugar, I topped them with a layer of dark chocolate. While the finished bars were tasty, they were not thick enough or lemony enough. If I make this again I will double the lemony layer.

I am not a rookie baker, but when I compose a recipe and 1 particular ingredient is used for 2 different purposes I usually put a comma at the end and the word "divided" that way people know not to add that one ingredient into one mixture because if a recipe is composed properly you don't need to read the directions just the bake time and temp. Thank goodness that 1/4C of flour isn't that big of a deal and keep the measurements the same as written in the ingredients (i.e. 1/4C not 4T = to 1/4C) for beginners because that could also be confusing unless you have a measurement sheet.
Also the video that is connected with this particular recipe can't even match up to it due to the confusion. If anyone has watched it.

I am not a rookie baker, but when I compose a recipe and 1 particular ingredient is used for 2 different purposes I usually put a comma at the end and the word "divided" that way people know not to add that one ingredient into one mixture because if a recipe is composed properly you don't need to read the directions just the bake time and temp. Thank goodness that 1/4C of flour isn't that big of a deal and keep the measurements the same as written in the ingredients (i.e. 1/4C not 4T = to 1/4C) for beginners because that could also be confusing unless you have a measurement sheet.
Also the video that is connected with this particular recipe can't even match up to it due to the confusion. If anyone has watched it.

I followed the other reviewers tips to increase the filling by 1/2, kept the crust as is in the recipe except for adding 1/2 cup flaxseed so I could feel a little healthy ??. The bars came out fabulous! Love it! 5 stars!
I doubled the recipe for the filling and kept everything else the same. They are delicious!

I made these even after reading the bad reviews. My crust took much longer to bake and I added more lemon juice and less sugar. Just the way I like it. Tart. It did take 20 mins to finish baking it but at least 30 mins for the crust. The filling looked a little skimpy so maybe I would increase the filling the next time by half as much but overall, pretty good. Filling baked up perfectly.

It was really good! I made half of the recipe to test it out (and because I had a much shallower pan), but the timing worked out perfectly and fortunately, nothing was under/overcooked. Next time I might add a bit more sugar/add icing on top for a bit more sweetness, but overall I loved the crust and it was very nice!
This one is always a good choice. Its our family's favorite!
so good love this recipe

Everyone loved these! I read some of the reviews (positive and negative). Decided to make the crust as directed. Was so easy. Bar cookie crusts are sometimes hard to spread completely in the pan. I love lemon, so I made 1 1/2 times the lemon filling. That was perfect for the crust. My filling took longer to set up because there was more. Just kept checking on it. The bars came out of the pan looking beautiful and tasting great!
I made it ant it was really good, I would have added more lemon, but that’s just me
My favorite lemon bar recipe
